intro: Esenbeckia panamensis, commonly known as Panama esenbeckia, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Panama. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are usually white or pale blue. Esenbeckia panamensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
